conclusion: On a straight highway, two cars, Car A and Car B, start simultaneously from the same position and move in the same direction with uniform accelerated linear motion. The graph shows the variation of the square of their velocities with displacement.

The image displays a graph with velocity squared (vÂ²) on the vertical axis and displacement (x) on the horizontal axis. Two lines, labeled A and B, represent the motion of two cars. Line A has a steeper slope than line B.
The acceleration of an object in uniform accelerated motion is related to the slope of the graph of velocity squared versus displacement. A steeper slope indicates a greater acceleration.

premise: Line A has a greater slope than line B.
conclusion: According to the relationship between acceleration and slope, the greater the slope, the greater the acceleration.

premise: Line A has a greater slope than line B. The greater the slope, the greater the acceleration.
conclusion: Car A, represented by line A, has a greater acceleration than Car B, represented by line B.
